page.title: 15Local History
page.content: This survey area has several interesting historical sites. Some are mentioned in detail on other pages, these are the others. Lucknam Park is now a stud farm.It was used as racing stables until 1980. Now it is owned by private people. It is still used as a stud farm.In the Domesday book it was called Luccas Hamlet. Bury Camp was an important hill-fort of the pre-historic Iron age. It is now farmland but can be visited by foot path. Euridge was mentioned in the Domesday book as Yew Tree Ridge, only a tiny part of the original Manor remains, like Colerne Manor it has been considerably rebuilt. There are also the remains of a Roman Villa under the aerodrome and part of the Fosse Way runs through the area.
